1.text: This is the account of Noah’s sons Shem, Ham, and Japheth, who also had sons after the flood.

2.text: The sons of Japheth: Gomer, Magog, Madai, Javan, Tubal, Meshech, and Tiras.

3.text: The sons of Gomer: Ashkenaz, Riphath, and Togarmah.

4.text: And the sons of Javan: Elishah, Tarshish, the Kittites, and the Rodanites.

5.text: From these, the maritime peoples separated into their territories, according to their languages, by clans within their nations.

6.text: The sons of Ham: Cush, Mizraim, Put, and Canaan.

7.text: The sons of Cush: Seba, Havilah, Sabtah, Raamah, and Sabteca. And the sons of Raamah: Sheba and Dedan.

8.text: Cush was the father of Nimrod, who began to be a mighty one on the earth.

9.text: He was a mighty hunter before the LORD; so it is said, “Like Nimrod, a mighty hunter before the LORD.”

10.text: His kingdom began in Babylon, Erech, Accad, and Calneh, in the land of Shinar.

11.text: From that land he went forth into Assyria, where he built Nineveh, Rehoboth-Ir, Calah,

12.text: and Resen, which is between Nineveh and the great city of Calah.

13.text: Mizraim was the father of the Ludites, the Anamites, the Lehabites, the Naphtuhites,

14.text: the Pathrusites, the Casluhites (from whom the Philistines came), and the Caphtorites.

15.text: And Canaan was the father of Sidon his firstborn, and of the Hittites,

16.text: the Jebusites, the Amorites, the Girgashites,

17.text: the Hivites, the Arkites, the Sinites,

18.text: the Arvadites, the Zemarites, and the Hamathites. Later the Canaanite clans were scattered,

19.text: and the borders of Canaan extended from Sidon toward Gerar as far as Gaza, and then toward Sodom, Gomorrah, Admah, and Zeboiim, as far as Lasha.

20.text: These are the sons of Ham according to their clans, languages, lands, and nations.

21.text: And sons were also born to Shem, the older brother of Japheth; Shem was the forefather of all the sons of Eber.

22.text: The sons of Shem: Elam, Asshur, Arphaxad, Lud, and Aram.

23.text: The sons of Aram: Uz, Hul, Gether, and Mash.

24.text: Arphaxad was the father of Shelah, and Shelah was the father of Eber.

25.text: Two sons were born to Eber: One was named Peleg, because in his days the earth was divided, and his brother was named Joktan.

26.text: And Joktan was the father of Almodad, Sheleph, Hazarmaveth, Jerah,

29.text: Ophir, Havilah, and Jobab. All these were sons of Joktan.

30.text: Their territory extended from Mesha to Sephar, in the eastern hill country.

31.text: These are the sons of Shem, according to their clans, languages, lands, and nations.

32.text: All these are the clans of Noah’s sons, according to their generations and nations. From these the nations of the earth spread out after the flood.
